text: I think the biggest challenges right now
There's a concerted movement of people
who think diversity is not beneficial

and they're trying to get it out
of the workplace and higher ed

there's a lot of
research that shows that

demographics in the United
States are changing.

Long-term projections
show that by mid-century,

we're going to be a
“majority minority” country,

and that getting rid of diversity
programs might serve short-term goals

to quiet down a loud
external constituency

but it could ultimately shoot companies
in the foot as demographics change

and attitudes change more broadly
in society around these issues.
